data.title: FILM: TAKING THE CHILDREN; Talk About Friendly! Now Casper Has A Crush on a Girl
data.text:
Mad Love Drew Barrymore, Chris O'Donnell Directed by Antonia Bird PG-13 99 minutes

Casey (Ms. Barrymore), the kind of girl who sets off false alarms at school, falls in love with Matt (Mr. O'Donnell), a more responsible type. When her parents object to the relationship, the two teen-agers run away together. They live an adolescent fantasy of freedom and independence until Casey starts acting weird. VIOLENCE Very little: one cigarette is poked in the face of a bad guy, and there's one brief fist fight. SEX Some, expressed as passionate kissing and ecstatic facial expressions. PROFANITY A smattering. FOOTNOTE Auto theft seems to be acceptable, and there doesn't seem to be much of a moral (unless it's "Don't leave town without your medication"). For Which Children? AGES 3 to 9 They'll be bored and possibly upset by some of Casey's behavior. AGES 10 and up The idea of playing grown-up is sure to be appealing, but because of the talk of suicide and the playfully reckless driving, the film should probably be reserved for the emotionally mature among this age group. ANITA GATES
